div.p: As a child I always wanted to do DJ-ing, the weird thing is I love DJ-ing like that’s all I would ever think about but I never saw it
as a full-time job maybe because I was sort of aware that it’s not something that you do until you’re like 50 or 60 years old
so it was always something that I wanted to do in my time but job-wise... To be totally honest with you, you know when they ask you
when you’re 15 or 16 what do you want to do when you leave school? The only thing I could say was like “I want to be a solicitor",
"I want to be a lawyer” I was interested in law but I still didn’t know what I really wanted to do so yeah I wanted to be a Fire Fighter
when I was 10 but then that idea went away because I didn’t see many black Fire Fighters at the time as well so I thought that was
beyond me, obviously now you’re older you sort of realise but at the time I thought it was beyond me so yeah I was really all about the place
I mean I remember at about 15 we had work experience and you could choose where you wanted to go and I remember my friend
must have chosen to work at a car mechanic, I think something like KwikFit or something like that, one of those car mechanic places
so I was like “oh yeah cool, cool give me the number let me sort that one out” because I was just so keen to sort my week out
for work experience I remember sorting it out, I went back home and I was like “mum I sorted out work experience for next month”
and she was like “oh what did you get?” and I was like “working at the car mechanic place” and she was like “you ain’t doing that”
and I couldn’t understand it and I was like “why?” Like “that’s work experience I’ll be able to see what a work environment’s like”
and she was like “no you don’t want to do that do you?” I was like “I don’t want to be a car mechanic but it’s the experience”
obviously you know when you’re a kid you don’t really see what your parents are trying to say but at that moment I realised
what she did was she cancelled it and got me work experience at a radio station alright, so it was something I really wanted to do
so basically my work experience I didn’t waste my time at all because it was something that I was interested in and keen with
and I worked at the local radio station and even just being like able to select tracks throughout the day was a big thing to me
so it’s one of those things I didn’t appreciate at the time but at that moment I could see what my mum was saying she was like
“do something that you like not just get it all sorted” so yeah, so I’d say DJ-ing, I always wanted to do that.
